benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: POST - Valid Payload: Success paths with required header only and with optional headers; single and multiple CustomField arrays; response array content validated (TC01–TC04).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, missing body, invalid invoiceItemId format, and missing required header produce 400 (TC06–TC09).
POST - Non-Existing Resource: 404 for non-existent invoice item and empty DB states (TC05, TC22, TC23).
Duplicate Submission/Idempotency & Concurrency: Retry after transient failure avoids duplicates; concurrent requests handled with appropriate codes and correct final state (TC16, TC25).
Large Payloads: Max-allowed count scenario covered (TC14).
Validation Edge Cases: Field length boundaries, special characters, and injection attempts covered (TC19–TC21).
Server Error Handling: Service unavailable 503 covered (TC13).
Integration/Persistence: Created fields retrievable via GET (TC18).
Performance: Normal and degraded response-time checks (TC15, TC24).
gaps: Content negotiation and media type: No test for missing/incorrect Content-Type header leading to 415; response Content-Type application/json not asserted.
CustomField schema validation: No tests for missing required properties within each object (e.g., name/value), nulls, or wrong data types while body is well-formed JSON.
Large payloads beyond limits: No explicit test for above-maximum arrays or payload-size limits that should result in 413 (separate from “at max” case).
Server error 500: No scenario simulating internal errors (e.g., DB failure) returning 500 as per POST guidelines.

Ambiguous expectations: Several tests allow multiple outcomes (e.g., TC11 extra fields: 201 or 400; TC14: 201 or 413; TC17 duplicates unspecified), reducing verifiability against a single expected behavior.
Idempotency without transient failure: No explicit test sending the exact same payload twice under normal conditions to assert business rule (no duplicates, consistent status such as 200/201/409).
Header validations: No tests for length/charset/Unicode handling of X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment, or auditing effects if required.
recommendations: Add media-type tests: send valid JSON with Content-Type missing or text/plain and assert 415; assert response Content-Type is application/json on success and errors.
Add schema-level validation tests: missing name/value, nulls, and wrong types inside CustomField objects; assert precise error structure and 400.
Split boundary tests: one for “at maximum” -> 201, another for “above maximum” -> 413; consider also testing large byte-size payloads (very long strings).
Add a 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., simulated DB failure) to meet POST server-error handling guidelines.
Make outcomes deterministic: replace “201 or 400/413” with the single expected code per spec for TC11, TC14, TC17; document business rules for extra fields and duplicate field names.
Add an explicit idempotency test: submit the identical request twice (no network failure) and verify no duplicate records, with defined expected status (e.g., 201 then 200 or 409).
Optionally add rate-limiting (429) tests if the API enforces throttling; and audit/traceability checks to ensure X-Killbill-Reason/Comment are recorded where applicable.
